intro: Leandra gorzulae, commonly known as the Gorzulae leandra, is a species of flowering plant native to the cloud forests of Costa Rica. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has elliptical leaves with a smooth surface and is often found growing in shaded, humid environments. It plays an important role in its ecosystem by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat. Due to its limited range and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
